attributes.action: Make First Aid Training compulsory in Schools, Colleges and new drivers
attributes.background: We should follow other European countries and make first aid training compulsory at various levels in schools and colleges and First training be compulsory for new drivers
attributes.additional_details: Sweden, Norway , Germany all deliver first aid at school age and for new drivers

attributes.action: British Government to reconsider its decision to renew the Lease on Chagos
attributes.background: The British Government decided to stop resettlement of the Chagossians. The Government should stop the renewal of the Lease in December 2016. If proceeds the natives would be too old or be dead in 2036, when  the lease expires.  Exiled for over 40 years. Join me in condemning this decision.
attributes.additional_details: The British Government has recently made £40M available in a pot to assist the Chagossians over the next 10 years. The sum is not sufficient to redress the wrong-doings by the Government and instead a more legitimate programme for resettlement of the Chagossians should be considered, wherever the Chagossians are today, irrespective of their current circumstances.  All the Chagossians HAVE BEEN UPROOTED and therefore should EACH be treated equally in benefiting from any form of redress.

attributes.action: Make putting an offer on a house purchase in England legally binding.
attributes.background: Far too many people are being let down and are also suffering unnecessary costs from the fact that people can put an offer on a house they want to buy and then withdraw at any point before exchange without penalty.
attributes.additional_details: Buying and selling houses is such a life changing and costly process it should not be subject to people changing their minds in a whim.  Many families can suffer heartache when a house chain collapses due to a person simply changing their mind.  I propose that before people enter a bid on a house they should get a survey and any searches competed and be in a position to pay a deposit.   This would add an a strong element of security to the house buying and selling process.

attributes.action: Allow current/new students to have free text books for university courses
attributes.background: It is only fair that current/new students get the fulfilment of their university course they pay for (£9,000 a year), by providing free set text books for each course they are on.
attributes.additional_details: With the decision made by the Government for tuition fees to rise further to £9,250 in the academic year of 2017, it is plausible for Parliament to enforce this.

attributes.action: Invest more money into scientific research to find the cause of M.E / CFS
attributes.background: M.E./CFS is a debilitating autoimmune disease currently affecting 250,000 people in the UK. Many sufferers are unable to work or care for themselves, and 25% of M.E. patients are bedbound. Most M.E. sufferers are on ESA or disability benefits, causing a significant economic burden.
attributes.additional_details: No universally effective treatment exists for M.E. Current NHS treatments for the illness are based on the controversial PACE trial, and have been found ineffective or even harmful. Good quality research into the root cause of the illness is needed. The current annual budget for biomedical research works at roughly £1 per patient per year. We want the budget for research to be dramatically increased. We also ask for the formation of a work group focussing on the issues surrounding this disease.

attributes.action: Change the law all assets to be sold/split equally when a relationship ends.
attributes.background: Current law allows the parent remaining with the kids to remain in the family home till the youngest turns 18. Leaving the other parent potentially homeless. The law needs to change so that the when separation/divorce happens all assets should be sold/divided equally allowing both to move on
attributes.additional_details: I am currently living with family as I can not afford nor get help with housing. I share my kids so when I have them I rely on family to put me and my kids up. This is extremely unfair on all. I am not the first nor will I be the last to find myself in this situation. Most people will know of someone having the same issue as myself. Mediation/solicitors/court costs if the law was changed so that when a couple separate/divorce all assets should be sold/divided equally it would save time and money

attributes.action: Change the dogs (fouling on land) act to include non public land
attributes.background: I live in a council property where the garden is shared. Another tennant leaves his dogs to defeacate in the garden without clearing it up. The council haven't acted in 4 months and police say can't enforce as land is not covered under the dogs (fouling on land) as its private or council property.
attributes.additional_details: I have video and photographic evidence of the fouling which has been left to rot for weeks/months where the garden is unfit for human use as confirmed by the local dog warden. The council had no housing officer covering the area so no one dealt with the complaint. Police could not act however if they could then this situation would not have got out of hand. And we wouldn't have to wait for the council.

attributes.action: Pass law to impound vehicles/caravans of travellers who damage public land.
attributes.background: Recently a travellers community has twice descended on our village, and twice been rapidly evicted by the local Council. The travellers, who act with a wholesome contempt for the law, have twice caused an indescribable and costly mess. This is a UK-wide problem. It's time to stop to this behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: If a group of travellers dumps vast quantities of bulk rubbish and human waste while they occupy public land, it costs tax payers' money to clean up. In these circumstances, the group's behaviour forfeits their right to live in this way. If they knew they could lose their vehicles/caravans, maybe they would behave differently. It's time to put a stop to this anti-social behaviour. Sign the petition and let's get our MPs to raise this issue in a Parliamentary debate!”

attributes.action: Amend the curriculum to include race relations as a compulsory area of study.
attributes.background: The state of race relations in the UK (and Europe) is worse than it has ever been during the course of my life. The concept of racial equality and appreciation of other religions, cultures and ethnicities must be taught from primary school onwards, so as to ensure that the UK operates harmoniously.
attributes.additional_details: Racial divide and the concept of the 'foreign other' is not natural. No child is born to notice that others are of a different skin tone to them - it is something that society engrains in us over time. Children must be taught that we are all equal for this country to truly prosper and lead from the front. Almost all hate crimes could be avoided if people were taught about racial equality from primary school onwards. The PM must be more proactive and not shirk her responsibility in this regard.

attributes.action: Create a bottle deposit scheme for the UK similar to those used in Scandinavia.
attributes.background: The deposit return scheme sees a small deposit (approx. 10p) added to the cost of a drinks container which is refunded when the container is recycled. The impacts in terms of energy costs and CO2 emissions can be considerable. The scheme also helps to reduce littering and it's environmental impacts.
attributes.additional_details: Sweden offers a world-leading example of how to deal with waste from drinks bottles and cans.  The scheme has resulted in recycling rates of more than 90 per cent of its drinks containers. Recycling glass can save 80 per cent of raw materials mined and, with recycled aluminium saving 95 per cent of the energy it takes to make new aluminium. The success of the 5 pence levy on single-use plastic bags proves that these kinds of policies can work well in the UK.

attributes.action: Extend sentencing powers to allow the use of lifetime bans from driving.
attributes.background: Many motorists obey the law till they get behind a steering wheel. They don't ever think of going to jail but would relate more to the possibility of being banned from driving for life. Such bans would be at the judge's discretion and only used for repeated bad driving or the most heinous incidents.
attributes.additional_details:
The kinds of cases I am thinking about include repeated use of mobile phones and repeated cases of drink- or drug-driving resulting in injury/death, or killing/injuring someone while driving at more than 20 per cent over a speed limit. 

While a long jail sentence is not always good for society, a short sentence and lifetime ban would emphasise the seriousness of an offence and give victims/relatives a stronger impression that justice had been done. Jail would be an option for breaches of a ban.

attributes.action: No assessments for DLA recipients when changing to PIP
attributes.background:
For people with long term disabilities that will not get better

If you have lost limbs, or an invisible disabilities such as Dyspraxia, Autism, or any disability that will never get better. ( There are loads of examples I could mention) You should not have to be reassessed for PIP.

attributes.action: Fathers to have 50/50 rights and stricter penalties for breach of court order
attributes.background: I want fathers to have equal rights in a family court and not just automatically given to the mother. Also a stronger penalty for breach of court order. With the person who is breachig the court order liable to pay costs towards a new court order.
attributes.additional_details:
Time and time again fathers are being stopped from seeing their children. Even with a visitation order, the ex partner can stop them and have to be taken back to court at the expense of the father again. 

It's a lengthy and costly process and the mother has automatic residency rights over the child. The current procedures don't do enough to stop a mother from blocking contact with their children. 

If the mother blocks contact without a valid excuse, she should be made to pay future court fees

attributes.action: Abellio Greater Anglia should compensate for delays longer than 15 minutes
attributes.background:
The lines operated by Abellio Greater Anglia are frequently subject to delays, causing severe disruption. 

The delay repay scheme should be amended to refund for delays greater than 15 minutes, instead of the current 30 minute threshold.
attributes.additional_details: The train operator c2c offer pro-rata compensation on delays over 2 minutes.

attributes.action: change the law of dogs on public footpaths and open land to no dogs allowed.
attributes.background: due to increasing livestock attacks due to dogs and a outdated law which can never be enforced if the police have no evidence then no action can be taken against the owners of the dog if they can be found...which in turn causes tens of thousands of damage to livestock and wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: its a well known fact the British news media does not report the real accounts of how many dog attacks there is on livestock / wildlife, but on other media sites it's widespread ..farming forums farming press you tube  etc ...but not everyone reads this media ..this law needs rewritten to which if there is no  written permission given for dogs allowed on a public path /open land then no dogs allowed ..

attributes.action: Bring the unaccompanied minors and others in the refugee camp in Calais to UK
attributes.background: To ask the Home Office to issue humanitarian visas to all those in the Calais camp (and the smaller number in Dunkerque) and arrange safe transport to Britain. As a priority, the unaccompanied minors should be brought to Britain as per the Dubs amendment.
attributes.additional_details: Two weeks ago, I went on a six day visit to the camp, having taken some aid for children and others and spent time with the people in the camp. There are businesses set up by inhabitants of the camp, some semblance of normality in an abnormal situation. There are schools, cafes and drop-in centres for the young. But the French authorities seem hell-bent on destroying such necessary amenities.  It is harassment of the most vulnerable people. Give these people the right to settle in UK.

attributes.action: Stop charging NHS staff for parking fees
attributes.background:
Payments are now been increased yearly.  Not adequate parking spaces hence time wasted in mornings looking for spaces.

Other businesses have free parking facilities.

Nursing should not pay to park when saving lives.

attributes.action: Give Special Constables who complete over 200 hours a year a tax incentive
attributes.background: Special Constables provide vital support to front line policing, giving up their free time, often days away from family, and even using leave from work to perform duties. Though no Special Constables do this for financial reward, all duties are performed voluntarily, often risking their own safety.
attributes.additional_details: Special Constables are expected to perform a minimum of 16 hours a month, yet most Special Constables go above and beyond, some completing upwards of 60 hours a month. One East Midlands force had Special Constables perform over 60,000 hours of duty in 2015, 59% of which were spent on frontline policing duties, responding to 999 calls and life or death situations. The rest carried out where either on local policing initiatives, community safety and training.

attributes.action: Reduce Business rates for small businesses and Sole traders.
attributes.background: Small businesses are in serious threat of being destroyed through ever heightening rent, and furthermore unreasonable, crippling business rates set by the government.  Rates are once again rising as of next year, despite the current economic difficulties for independent businesses.
attributes.additional_details: Remember, charities that occupy commercial properties are exempt from business rates, which increases the demand from small and large businesses alike.  Rates are currently destroying family/small businesses.  Lets get this changed.

attributes.action: Make umbilical/placental donation available to mothers all over the UK.
attributes.background: I have 2 children, Jack (17 months), and Alfred who is 5 weeks old.I looked into umbilical donation when I was having Alfie. I was disappointed when I realised this service is only available in 4 hospitals in the UK and therefore would not be an option to me! What a waste of life saving stem cells!
attributes.additional_details: Cord blood and stem cells are used to repair damaged tissue, regrow and replace worn out organs and cure life threatening illnesses, yet umbilical donation is only available in 4 hospitals throughout the UK. Hundreds of thousands umbilical cords and placentas are simply binned and destroyed every year.

attributes.action: Stop road resurfacing with tar and chippings
attributes.background: Stop resurfacing roads using tar and chippings, it is extrememly dangerous for cyclists and motorbike riders and can also damage car paint work (even when the 20mph limit is adhered too) not to mention the herrendous mess which it can cause when the stones are carried hundreds of meteres away.

attributes.action: Negotiate safe removal of children and pregnant women from Syrian cities
attributes.background: The situation in Syria, particularly in Eastern Aleppo and other areas under siege, continues to deteriorate beyond what is livable. Attempts at peace have failed. We believe that the United Kingdom must lead the way in providing the safe removal of children and pregnant women from these areas.
attributes.additional_details:
Eastern Aleppo's children's hospital has been bombed. Sick children and babies have no place to receive basic care. Other basic resources, such as food, are running out.

The UK understands the importance of removing women and children from cities being bombed, as this was practised during WWII. The situation is even more dire in Syria. We cannot stand by and do nothing. The UK must lead. We mus act now to save these children.

attributes.action: Support for sliding scale payments to 1950s women instead of total pension loss.
attributes.background: Delayed pension payments to women born in 1950s seems unnecessarily harsh with little or no redress or power to have a say in this decision.
attributes.additional_details: At 60 I work freelance p/t occasionally. This is enough work for me (everyone is different) but I am sure 60 year + women would not want to work full time if the main reason is to support a changed government policy.   It would be sensible to have a sliding scale of pension rather than absolutely nothing causing hardship during the years 1950's women have to wait to receive their pension - that they have rightly paid into all their working lives and will now lose up to £30k per women.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all businesses to hold a defibrillator on site.
attributes.background: Defibrillators save lives. If someone has a cardiac arrest time is everything. Having tools available to hand can give people a chance of survival.I lost my mum to cardiac arrest while she was at work & there was no difibrillator on site even though she worked in a large scale government building.
attributes.additional_details: A defibrillator is a device that gives a high energy electric shock to the heart through the chest wall to someone who is in cardiac arrest.

attributes.action: UK residents without right to vote in general elections to be income tax exempt
attributes.background: No taxation without representation. There are millions of people living, working, and paying taxes in the UK, but with no right to participate to national politics with their vote. Parliament and Government do not represent them, and should not dispose of the tax revenues raised through their work.
attributes.additional_details:
The numbers say that foreigners positively contribute to the UK revenue. The last Governments have pursued austerity policies, and have not invested this additional income to fund health, education, and housing systems. Instead, foreigners are have been blamed to put pressure on these systems.
The Government is not accountable to foreigners because they have no right to vote. This is against the spirit of John Hampden, English great patriot, who first claimed "no taxation without representation"

attributes.action: Stop schools from giving awards for 100% attendance.
attributes.background: Schools often issue awards for children who attain 100% attendance. Apart from the fact that this discriminates against many children who have medical appointments which cannot be arranged out of term time, absence from school for certain illnesses is required, making 100% attendance impossible.
attributes.additional_details: Many of the childhood illnesses children contract are caught from their classmates, at school. Many of these illnesses, such as chicken pox, rotavirus and impetigo, require children to be absent from school for a minimum period of time before returning. This means the 100% attendance award is an impossibility and awarding it to children who have somehow managed not to suffer from these illnesses throughout the school year makes other children feel inadequate. It's discriminatory and must stop.

attributes.action: Stop car insurance companies increasing prices after a non-fault accident.
attributes.background: Currently, insurers can charge more for customers who have been involved in a non- fault accident in the past 5 years. As an 18 year old, I was involved in one and my insurance costs went up by 20% as a result. I fail to see why people who are not at fault for an accident should be punished for it.

attributes.action: Make the time of paternity leave longer than 2 weeks
attributes.background: 2 weeks is not enough time for a father to bond with their child. In those first weeks skin to skin is so important to establish a bond between parent and child. It also is good to have helping hands after a mother has given birth (including after major surgery).
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.economist.com/blogs/economist-explains/2015/05/economist-explains-18

http://national.deseretnews.com/article/2143/10-reasons-dads-should-take-paternity-leave.html

attributes.action: For the NHS to fund mTOR inhibitor and for free.
attributes.background: It will help those with TSC, will help with the facial rash that develops during the course of childhood, and will clear the rash up that is caused by TSC.
attributes.additional_details: Letters from NHS,Queen,Prime minister, and department of health.

attributes.action: Remove the luxury tax on feminine hygiene products once and for all time!
attributes.background: In the UK, flapjacks and crocodile meat are at a 0% VAT rate, yet an essential item for all women is classed under the 'luxury' tax bracket. The so called 'tampon tax' is a ridiculous way of financially victimising women. We the people (signed below) demand an end to this deliberate extortion.

attributes.action: To provide free access to swimming pools and lessons to anyone under 18 yrs old.
attributes.background: After the tragic deaths in Aug 2016 please sign my petition asking for FREE access to swimming pools & swimming lessons to anyone under the age of 18 in the UK. Around 40% of children cannot properly swim & over 400 people drown in the UK every year. There is an easy way to reduce these figures.
attributes.additional_details: I am a keen pool, sea and river swimmer who feels shocked each and every time I hear of another life lost in the beautiful waters this country has in abundance. I never again want to hear a report of someone dying trying to save another human being or rescue a pet. I strongly believe that there can only be benefits to a nationwide swimming policy that improves health and encourages the use and support of local facilities.

attributes.action: Lowering the voting age to 16
attributes.background: We believe that the voting age should be lowered as 16-17 year olds live by the laws created by a government that we have not chosen. We think that this is unfair. We can pick our college subjects that decide our future. So why can't we decide who decides the future of our country?
attributes.additional_details: Research showed that 73% of young people voted to remain in the EU. This suggests that the majority of older people voted to leave. We think that this is unfair, as the repercussions will be felt more by 16-17 year olds as we are beginning to head out into the world of work and our lives will be shaped by the choices of older people. Furthermore, now that we do not get governed by the EU parliament, it is more important than ever that we get a government that we support, not one we get given.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for disabled toilets to be used as storage
attributes.background:
In the news 18th July 2016 eurostar were using disabled toilets for push bikes , this is not unusual in the few months I've found two pubs I'm my local area using their disabled toilet as storage for high chairs .
Disabled toilets are for easy access  not storage.
attributes.additional_details: Eurostar storing bikes in disabled toilets - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36820751

attributes.action: Factor wealth and assets outside of salary into CMS calculation & remove cap.
attributes.background:
Legal loophole allows wealthy fathers to pay nothing for their children;
The CMS doesn't look at assets or wealth outside of salary therefore individuals paid via dividends/international income streams are outside of its jurisdiction. Salary above £156k not factored in, disadvantaging children.
attributes.additional_details:
Schedule 1 of the Children's Act used to provide an alternative assessment pathway but mothers questing for justice are at the mercy of UK law; things have gone from bad to worse since a case led to Judges not applying Schedule 1 of the Children's Act until a tribunal hearing via the CMS has been reached and won; seemingly impossible to do when the CMS don't look at wealth outside of salary. 
http://www.familylawweek.co.uk/site.aspx?i=ed143067
http://www.familylawweek.co.uk/site.aspx?i=ed143343

attributes.action: Suspend the 12 billion spent on overseas aid for cancer treatment and research.
attributes.background: One in two people are now affected by cancer. Since 2010 six of my relatives/ friends have died from cancer. Eight people I know currently have cancer, two with terminal cancer. A close relative is one of the two.
attributes.additional_details: The U.K. gives 12 billion pounds a year (0.7% GNI - source BBC - 2015) in overseas aid. I am not suggesting that this is stopped, only that as cancer is now so prevalent in our country ( one in two people are now affected - my husband's consultant quoted this) that temporarily this money is used to help the people in need in this country. Walk down the main corridor at The Christie (cancer specialist hospital) in Manchester at 9.00 am on any weekday to see how many people have this illness, and this is only one example of a hospital in the UK.

attributes.action: Licence and regulate nail technicians, hairdressers and beauticians.
attributes.background: People in the hair and beauty industry are not always qualified or have only done 1 day of training which isnt enough, these uneducated people are working on the public with no knowlage and insurance. They are also causing harm and damage to the public aswell as illegal workers being exploited.
attributes.additional_details: Not being educated in this industry, working on the public and having illness, disabilities, young children and exploitation of illegal workers could cause serious harm to people. Also the people who are working without the correct qualification IS NOT able to obtain any form of insurance meaning they are not covered incase of accident or damage.

attributes.action: Force Local Authorities to allocate a proportion of housing to pet owners.
attributes.background: People are being forced to make the decision between giving up their pets or being homeless.  For some people their pet is the only family they have, and the animal is often vital for helping with mental health issues. People end up living on the streets rather than giving up their beloved friend.
attributes.additional_details: In every town in Britain there are people living on the streets, for no other reason than their local authority is refusing to home them. They are given the impossible choice of giving up their pet or being homeless. They are vulnerable people, and are being discriminated against for sharing love and companionship with a pet. It would be detrimental for them to lose their pets, and would put additional strain on the mental health service. They are at risk of serious harm or death on the street.

attributes.action: Make health warnings compulsory on processed meat.
attributes.background: Since the world health authority classified processed meat as class one carcinogen to humans. (Definitely causes cancer.) There should be health warnings placed on all packaging, in the same way the warnings have to be on cigarettes.
attributes.additional_details: Class 1 carcinogen = definitely causes cancer in humans as classified by WHO.

attributes.action: Amend the1967 abortion act.No abortion after 24 weeks. Equality for all.
attributes.background:
In the UK it is legal to terminate a pregnancy up untill birth if the child has a disability such as Downs Syndrome. However it is illegal to terminate a child without a disability after 24 weeks.Help me to outlaw disability based abortions.No abortion after 24 weeks. 
#tellitrightstartitright
attributes.additional_details:
Lord Shinkwin’s Bill wants to outlaw abortions on the grounds of disability
If successful, the Abortion (Disability Equality) Bill will remove section 1(1)(d) from the 1967 Abortion Act, which allows for abortion on the grounds of disability up-to-birth. In the UK, disability-selective abortions are currently available right up to the moment of birth whereas in most cases, “healthy” babies cannot be aborted beyond 24 weeks.
#equalityforall
#tellitrightstartitright 
#SaveourDownsydromecommunity

attributes.action: Make schools relax their uniform policies
attributes.background: Schools are turning pupils away due to uniform violations which disrupts a child's education. Schools should be made to relax these draconian policies. A parent is fined for taking their child out in term time, yet schools openly send children home. Clothing does not have a bearing on education!
attributes.additional_details:
Why do schools think it's ok to disrupt a child's education in this way? This denies children the education they are entitled to. The strict uniform policies are often discriminatory and unfair, if not petty.
School uniforms are a part of school life, this is accepted, but why does the 'wrong colour' black shoe or wrong type of material matter?  A child's education should matter more than the cut of their clothing. Make schools relax their policies to ensure all children are treated fairly!

attributes.action: stop charging staff and service users parking at Southmead hospital in Bristol.
attributes.background: Currently cost a full time worker £300 minimum  a year for a parking permit yet there is not enough spaces. Service users are also charged for Parking.

attributes.action: Allow  my husband to live in the UK with his wife and daughter.
attributes.background: His spouse visa has been denied on the basis that 1 the financial side and 2 a place of residence upon arrival to the UK . Despite my mother writing a letter to confirm that me my husband and kids will be staying with her until we found a place of our own.
attributes.additional_details: we clearly mentioned in our appeal that life in the US wasn't good and I wanted to come home to the UK to be with my family and our daughter can grow up with her cousins something we don't have in the US.we arrived in the UK to spend time with the family our daughter goes to stay n play which she loves and is able to go to nursery for 15 hrs a week she's settled down perfectly my wife is staying in the UK to settle down get a house  our daughter and son can be with the family They are thriving.

attributes.action: Close all faith schools immediately and make a more harmoneous population !.
attributes.background: Our children are the future but in this world of uncertainty and hurt we seem to encourage it by allowing faith schools to propagate . This is wrong and now more than ever ! we need to make certain that our children's future is secure and free from hate and prejudice...
attributes.additional_details: I was educated in a catholic school .... But my mum was a catholic and my dad was a prodestant and neither cared about religion !! Which is how it should be .....I realised early on that we are all the same and at this early age we have the chance to guarantee the same future for our children and our children's children ....but we need to mix all the kids together and let them experience thus for themselves and we need to do it now !!....not tomorrow or the next day but now ...today

attributes.action: Driving - Impose a compulsory ability re-test every 10 years for all UK drivers.
attributes.background: I propose that all drivers should be given an ability re-test every 10 years from the date of driving test pass. This is not a full test the same as the first driving test but an ability test to ensure all drivers are safe, aware, knowledgeable enough to handle the UK's roads safely.
attributes.additional_details:
In industry it is normal practice and a lawful H&S requirement to retest workers for various different skills (i.e. first aid, electrical safety, handling of heavy machinery) so why does this not apply to drivers? This will ensure only competent and safe drivers take to the roads. It will weed out those individuals who are no longer capable of driving a vehicle for whatever reason.
Those convicted of a serious motoring offence should also be ordered to take the test to re-gain their licence.

attributes.action: Increase defence spending to 3% GDP as US calls for NATO allies to do more.
attributes.background:
The US accounts for 72% of total spending in NATO. 
President-elect Donald J Trump has called for the remaining members to pay their share, 2% GDP, on defence. 
The UK has an opportunity to lead the way and break through the 2% of GDP, showing Europe that we must take the NATO alliance seriously
attributes.additional_details:
The UK pays in more to defence than any other member of NATO outside of the USA. 
By further increasing our spending to 3%, almost a match to the USA, we solidify our commitment to NATO, showing America that we support the President's call and are the USA's true friend and ally in this matter.
We will show other large NATO nations that they must do more to help the defence of the alliance.
http://www.nato.int/nato_static_fl2014/assets/pdf/pdf_2016_01/20160129_160128-pr-2016-11-eng.pdf

attributes.action: Table a UN Security Council resolution on Daesh to end impunity for genocide
attributes.background:
HMG must take decisive steps to: 
1. table a UN SC resolution establishing a commission of experts on genocide and then establishing an ad hoc tribunal; or 
2. table a UN SC resolution referring the situation in Syria and Iraq (as caused by Daesh since 2014) to the International Criminal Court.
attributes.additional_details: Daesh is responsible for genocidal atrocities on minorities, including Christians, Yazidis, and other religious minorities, in the Middle East and beyond. This genocide was recognized by the European Parliament, the Council of Europe, and the US, Australian, and Canadian governments. In April 2016, the House of Commons called upon HMG to take the lead at the UN SC. This steps has not been taken yet and is urgently needed to end impunity and to ensure that justice is served.

attributes.action: Bring back Dartford crossing barriers to even out traffic flow.
attributes.background: Bring back Dartford crossing barriers to limit the amount of traffic going into the tunnel or on the bridge at once. This could help to reduce accidents also.
attributes.additional_details: The fines are not being spent well enough if they have to be in place! Use this money to help improve our traffic flow!

attributes.action: Take care of our Homeless before  housing  20,000 Syrian Refugees
attributes.background: The Government have announced that local authorities have found enough properties to house 20,000 Syrian Refugees,
attributes.additional_details: This is disgusting we have homeless people including ex members of the armed forces who have fought for this country who have nowhere to live and yet they want to home people from abroad who have never paid anything into the system getting not only free houses but no doubt benefits that we pay for as well

attributes.action: Minimum 5 years in prison for possession of indecent photograph of a child
attributes.background: I think it's very shocking that people found in possession of child porn (criminal justice act 1988 section 160) get maximum of 5 years prison. This should be changed straight away and I think personally they should be locked up for life, but I know this ain't realistic for the government.
attributes.additional_details: This is to out of date and should be changed straight away as well as criminal justice act 1978 section 1

attributes.action: Have schools teach children the signs of domestic abuse, physical & emotional.
attributes.background: There are too many people who are being abused in their home and we need to make people including young children who may be victims of it aware of the signs so they can go for help if they need to. It will help reduce the amount of deaths each year which go unnoticed.
attributes.additional_details: There are many helpline such as Rising Sun but we need to make sure children and even adults are aware of this as well as aware of the tell tale signs that someone is a victim of abuse, or that they may be a victim.
